title: Getting started as a DJ: Mixing, mashups and digital turntables - Cole Plante

multiple-choice.question: What is the DJ/Producer's main goal when mixing tracks?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a long and boring mix.

options.label: B
options.text: To trigger samples, tracks, or clips and create a journey.

options.label: C
options.text: To only play one song at a time.

options.label: D
options.text: To only play music from one genre at a time.

multiple-choice.question: What is a "mashup" in DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: A song that is played only once.

options.label: B
options.text: A song that is played twice in a row.

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of two or more tracks into one.

options.label: D
options.text: A song that is played only at night.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the most important things about dance music?

options.label: A
options.text: The beat.

options.label: B
options.text: The melody.

options.label: C
options.text: The drop.

options.label: D
options.text: The lyrics.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the best ways to learn how to DJ?

options.label: A
options.text: By watching YouTube videos.

options.label: B
options.text: By asking a friend who knows how to DJ.

options.label: C
options.text: By reading books about DJing.

options.label: D
options.text: By taking a class.

multiple-choice.question: What is a mixer in DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: A device that plays music.

options.label: B
options.text: A device that records music.

options.label: C
options.text: A device that has many different effects, such as a beat roll and filter effects.

options.label: D
options.text: A device that only plays one song at a time.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the great things about technologies now in DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: That it is only for rich people.

options.label: B
options.text: That it is only for professionals.

options.label: C
options.text: That almost anyone who has a passion for DJing and a passion for the music and who might want to pursue a career in it really has the ability to pursue it.

options.label: D
options.text: That it is only for beginners.

multiple-choice.question: What can you start with in DJing?

options.label: A
options.text: A professional DJ setup.

options.label: B
options.text: A two dollar app on a tablet or an app on your phone.

options.label: C
options.text: A mixer and a turntable.

options.label: D
options.text: A CD player.

multiple-choice.question: What can you use to launch samples, clips, and tracks?

options.label: A
options.text: A mixer.

options.label: B
options.text: A turntable.

options.label: C
options.text: A hardware system, such as an APC40.

options.label: D
options.text: A CD player.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the many hardware systems that can launch samples, clips, and tracks?

options.label: A
options.text: A turntable.

options.label: B
options.text: A CD player.

options.label: C
options.text: A Novation Launchpad.

options.label: D
options.text: A mixer.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the many programs that can be used to DJ?

options.label: A
options.text: Ableton.

options.label: B
options.text: Traktor Pro.

options.label: C
options.text: Serato.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

title: Caesium or Cesium - Periodic Table of Videos

multiple-choice.question: What is the surprising use of caesium?

options.label: B
options.text: It is used to measure temperature.

options.label: C
options.text: It is used to measure pressure.

options.label: D
options.text: It is used to measure volume.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they want to measure the speed of light.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they want to measure the temperature of the Earth.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: According to Mark Zuckerberg, what does the term "filter bubble" refer to?

options.label: A
options.text: A personalized news feed that shows you only what you want to see.

options.label: B
options.text: A world in which the internet shows us what it thinks we want to see, but not necessarily what we need to see.

options.label: C
options.text: A way of blocking unwanted information on the internet.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of algorithm that filters out irrelevant information.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mark Zuckerberg notice on his Facebook page that made him realize the issue of filter bubbles?

options.label: A
options.text: That his conservative friends' posts were being hidden from his feed.

options.label: B
options.text: That his liberal friends' posts were being hidden from his feed.

options.label: C
options.text: That he was seeing a lot of spam posts in his feed.

options.label: D
options.text: That he was seeing a lot of posts from people he didn't know.

multiple-choice.question: What did Google engineer tell Mark Zuckerberg about the signals Google looks at to personalize search results?

options.label: A
options.text: 57 signals, including what kind of computer you're on and where you're located.

options.label: B
options.text: 57 signals, including what kind of browser you're using and what you're searching for.

options.label: C
options.text: 57 signals, including what you've clicked on before and what you're searching for.

options.label: D
options.text: 57 signals, including what you've liked on Facebook and what you're searching for.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mark Zuckerberg ask a group of friends to do to demonstrate the issue of filter bubbles?

options.label: A
options.text: To Google the same thing and send him screenshots of their results.

options.label: B
options.text: To search for the same thing on different search engines and send him the results.

options.label: C
options.text: To look at the same website and tell him what they saw.

options.label: D
options.text: To read the same article and tell him what they thought of it.

multiple-choice.question: What did researchers at Netflix discover about the Netflix cue?

options.label: A
options.text: That there was an epic struggle going on between our future aspirational selves and our more impulsive present selves.

options.label: B
options.text: That people were watching a lot of the same movies.

options.label: C
options.text: That people were watching a lot of different movies.

options.label: D
options.text: That people were watching movies were not very good at predicting what they would like.

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem with algorithmic filters, according to Mark Zuckerberg?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too biased towards what people want to see.

options.label: B
options.text: They are not transparent enough.

options.label: C
options.text: They are not giving people a balanced information diet.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mark Zuckerberg say about the founding mythology of the internet?

options.label: A
options.text: That it was a broadcast society where gatekeepers controlled the flow of information.

options.label: B
options.text: That it was a world where everyone had equal access to information.

options.label: C
options.text: That it was a world where algorithms controlled the flow of information.

options.label: D
options.text: That it was a world where people had to pay for information.

multiple-choice.question: What does Mark Zuckerberg say is the solution to the problem of filter bubbles?

options.label: A
options.text: To make algorithms more transparent.

options.label: B
options.text: To give people more control over what they see.

options.label: C
options.text: To encode civic responsibility into the code of algorithms.

options.label: D
options.text: All of the above.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mark Zuckerberg say is the goal of the internet?

options.label: A
options.text: To connect people and introduce them to new ideas and perspectives.

options.label: B
options.text: To make people more isolated and less connected.

options.label: C
options.text: To give people more information, but not necessarily more knowledge.

options.label: D
options.text: To make people more knowledgeable, but not necessarily more connected.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mark Zuckerberg say is the problem with the current state of the internet?

options.label: A
options.text: That it is not giving people enough information.

options.label: B
options.text: That it is giving people too much information.

options.label: C
options.text: That it is not giving people a balanced information diet.

options.label: D
options.text: That it is leaving people isolated in a web of one.

title: What we can learn from galaxies far, far away - Henry Lin

multiple-choice.question: What are galaxy clusters?

options.label: A
options.text: They are collections of individual stars.

options.label: B
options.text: They are collections of galaxies bound together by their mutual gravity.

options.label: C
options.text: They are made up of dark matter and hot gas.

options.label: D
options.text: They are the smallest units of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the mass of the galaxy cluster shown in the image?

options.label: A
options.text: Over 100 billion suns.

options.label: B
options.text: Over 1 million billion suns.

options.label: C
options.text: Over 10 trillion suns.

options.label: D
options.text: Over 100 trillion suns.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main feature of galaxy clusters?

options.label: A
options.text: They are isolated systems.

options.label: B
options.text: They are made up of individual stars.

options.label: C
options.text: They are the smallest units of the universe.

options.label: D
options.text: They are the largest units of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason for the extreme gravity of galaxy clusters?

options.label: A
options.text: It is due to the presence of dark matter.

options.label: B
options.text: It is due to the presence of hot gas.

options.label: C
options.text: It is due to the mutual gravity of the galaxies.

options.label: D
options.text: It is due to the expansion of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind the X-ray light emitted by galaxy clusters?

options.label: A
options.text: It is due to the presence of hot gas.

options.label: B
options.text: It is due to the presence of dark matter.

options.label: C
options.text: It is due to the presence of individual stars.

options.label: D
options.text: It is due to the expansion of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the nature of dark matter?

options.label: A
options.text: It is made up of atoms.

options.label: B
options.text: It is made up of particles that interact through gravity.

options.label: C
options.text: It is made up of particles that do not interact with each other.

options.label: D
options.text: It is made up of hot gas.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why galaxy clusters can teach us about dark matter?

options.label: A
options.text: It is because they are the smallest units of the universe.

options.label: B
options.text: It is because they are the largest units of the universe.

options.label: C
options.text: It is because they are representative slices of the universe.

options.label: D
options.text: It is because they are made up of individual stars.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name given to the cause of the accelerated expansion of the universe?

options.label: A
options.text: Dark energy.

options.label: B
options.text: Dark matter.

options.label: C
options.text: Hot gas.

options.label: D
options.text: Expansion of the universe.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind the analogy of the sinking of the Titanic?

options.label: A
options.text: It is to model the little positions of every single little piece of the boat that broke off.

options.label: B
options.text: It is to track the two biggest parts of the boat.

options.label: C
options.text: It is to model the expansion of the universe.

options.label: D
options.text: It is to model the presence of dark matter.

multiple-choice.question: What is the quote by Henry Ford?

options.label: A
options.text: "If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said faster horses."

options.label: B
options.text: "If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said slower cars."

options.label: C
options.text: "If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said bigger cars."

options.label: D
options.text: "If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said smaller cars."
